message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.LG, cs.MA 

This paper presents a new action language for reasoning about probabilistic causal and narrative information. It builds on the Event Calculus (EC) and its epistemic extension EFEC, which are commonly used in artificial intelligence and logic. Therefore, cs.AI is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the semantics of the language in terms of possible worlds, which is a topic in logic (cs.LO). Additionally, the paper presents an ASP implementation of the language, which falls under the sub-category of programming languages (cs.PL). The use of probabilistic reasoning also suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and possibly multi-agent systems (cs.MA).
